thread.title: U.S. Department of Treasury Apologizes to Reagan Wireless Corp. For Inaccuracies In 2006 Accountability Report
thread.title_full: U.S. Department of Treasury Apologizes to Reagan Wireless Corp. For Inaccuracies In 2006 Accountability Report - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: U.S. Department of Treasury Apologizes to Reagan Wireless Corp. For Inaccuracies In 2006 Accountability Report
text:
Reagan Wireless Corp.
DEERFIELD BEACH, Fla. , Oct. 20, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The U.S. Department of Treasury apologized to Reagan Wireless Corp. for inaccuracies in their 2006 Accountability Report and for subsequent problems this has caused the company. These inaccuracies were related to the purchase of used scrap phones purchased by Reagan Wireless in the years from 1999-2001.
In a letter from Patricia Moss , Assistant Director, Financial Management and Operations at the U.S. Department:
"This letter confirms that the entry for the Reagan Wireless case was removed from the 2006 Accountability Report, for the Treasury Forfeiture Fund, because the entry contained inaccuracies. The Department of the Treasury regretfully apologizes for any problems this may have caused your client. It is our hope that the removal of this information will address any concerns of your client, Reagan Wireless, regarding the 2006 Accountability Report."
Click here to view the letter in its entirety:
https://www.reaganwireless.com/us-treasury-dept-apologizes-to-reagan-wireless-201503251544.pdf
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/us-department-of-treasury-apologizes-to-reagan-wireless-corp-for-inaccuracies-in-2006-accountability-report-300163346.html
